original_title: Sri Lanka’s shares edge up in mid day trade
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka shares edge up in mid day trade on very thin volumes on Wednesday, Colombo Stock Exchange data showed.
Investors await for more clarity on local debt restructuring as the government promises to disclose the framework in May, an analyst said.
The main All Share Price Index (ASPI) was up 0.05 percent or 4.51 points to 8,827.52, while the most liquid index S&P SL20 was down 0.07 percent or 1.87 points to 2,540.81.

The government has disclosed that the stance on domestic debt restructuring will be made aware towards the end of May, however The International Monetary Fund is in constant dialog with Sri Lanka over domestic debt restructuring plans, Senior Mission Chief Peter Breuer said.
Top gainers were Bukit Darah, Lanka IOC and Expolanka. (Colombo/May17/2023)
